pullRequest.title: Fix class cast exception in the pg_catalog.pg_stat table.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Summary of the changes / Why this improves CrateDB
The most_common_vals and histogram_bounds have the
array(text) data type. If any of these columns would
have the array or object value, the class cast exception will be
thrown such as object::text and array::text operations
are supported. This change addresses this issue.
Checklist

 Added an entry in CHANGES.txt for user facing changes
 Updated documentation & sql_features table for user facing changes
 Touched code is covered by tests
 CLA is signed
 This does not contain breaking changes, or if it does:

It is released within a major release
It is recorded in CHANGES.txt
It was marked as deprecated in an earlier release if possible
You've thought about the consequences and other components are adapted
(E.g. AdminUI)

beforeCommit.message:
Fix class cast exception in the pg_catalog.pg_stat table.

The ``most_common_vals`` and ``histogram_bounds`` have the
``array(text)`` data type. If any of these columns would
have the array or object value, the class cast exception will be
thrown such as ``object::text`` and ``array::text`` operations
are supported. This change addresses this issue.

thrown such as ``object::text`` and ``array::text`` operations
are supported. This change addresses this issue.

nodes.bodyText:
maybe add this to https://github.com/crate/crate/blob/master/server/src/test/java/io/crate/integrationtests/AnalyzeITest.java
Otherwise I  think it won't be clear which test cases should go to what test class as both are closely related

+

beforeCommit.message:
Fix class cast exception in the pg_catalog.pg_stat table.

The ``most_common_vals`` and ``histogram_bounds`` have the
``array(text)`` data type. If any of these columns would
have the array or object value, the class cast exception will be
thrown such as ``object::text`` and ``array::text`` operations
are supported. This change addresses this issue.
